result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Craig Haider

records.addlTxt: 2:34 PM David Craig Haider does not appear in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius,  ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes Deputy is present. Due to non-appearance State is requesting a warrant Adj. States and asked for costs at the last hearing and is asking the Court assess $90.00 for the Officers time. Court will authorize warrant Adj. States and will order costs in the amount of $90.00 for the officer. Court adjourned at 2:36 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:04 PM Defendant David Craig Haider in court, in custody.   Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Craig Haider appeared by video means. Katelyn Dippolito appears with defendant.  PD addresses court regarding defendant's failure to appear.  ADA quashes warrant, asks bond be reinstated in it's entirely.  Set for preliminary hearing.  Off record for scheduling.  Defendant to be going to treatment, will know more Monday, July 11, 2022, to notify clerk's office of new address. Currently does not have phone number and will also notify court of new number.  Adjourned at 3:11 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
DE in custody - E: DA, Atty & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif
FTA date is incorrect on the warrant, should be 6-14-22
Extradite Adj. States       JRG signed 6/14/22 - E: DA, Atty & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

3:46 PM Defendant David Craig Haider does not appear in Court, Atty Derek W Sanders, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sanders has no information. ADA Walker is requesting a warrant Adj. States and asks if DE fails to appear again the State will ask for costs for Officer. Court will authorize warrant adj. States. Court adjourned at 3: 48 pm.
filed by Atty Sanders

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH C.R.B. OR T.L.K.
Take medications as prescribed.
Def from PCJ

3:15 PM Defendant David Craig Haider appears from Jail via video, Atty Derek W Sanders appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court will quash the warrant. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NC w/C.R.B. or T.L.K. and take meds, no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:24 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
